movements.tempo: Repeat of the second part of the Prestissimo

entries.notes: According to Boccherini's autograph catalogue as printed by Alfredo Boccherini, op. 41 comprises only two quintets (Nos. 346 and 347), a symphony (No. 519) and the minuets for a ball (No. 525). Picquot, however, describes this and the following quartet (No. 215) as parts of op. 41 and the works appear in the year 1788 in the thematic catalogue sent by Boccherini to Pleyel (see Bibliography).

sources.first_edition: 1798, Paris, Pleyel: Op. 39 no. 8 (Book 3 no. 2; for title and comment, see No. 234)
sources.modern_edition: 1952, Kassel, Barenreiter: Op. 39 (separate parts; revised by Walter Upmeyer), no. 4 in L. Boccherini Ausgewahlte Streichquartette

continues_from_previous.notes: Arrangement: Of the fourth movement, as part of a quartet (no. 2) for flute, clarinet, horn and bassoon, by O. Van den Broek, c. 1810 (see No. 262).
